body: I can reproduce in a new curl test case.
Is this a regression, do you know?

issue.title: netrc: fix password-only entries

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
When a specific hostname matched, and only a password is set before another machine is specified in the netrc file, the parser would not be happy and stop there and return the password-only state. It instead continued and did not return a match.

Added test 2005 to verify this case

Reported-by: Ben Zanin
Fixes #15767

body: I do believe it is a regression, yes: `.netrc` files with multiple entries pulled in via `--netrc-optional` work in curl versions prior to 8.x, e.g. 7.88.1 as packaged in Debian Bookworm.
I just checked. I broke this in e9b9bbac22c2. It worked fine in 8.11.0.

issue.title: curl: 8.11.1 fails to parse password-only netrc entries
issue.body:
### Nixpkgs version

- Unstable (25.05)
- Stable (24.11)

### Describe the bug

This is another netrc parsing bug. curl 8.11.1 fails to parse password-only entries when they're followed by other entries. Unlike the previous netrc bugs in 8.11.x, there's no visible error to indicate that the entry was not correctly parsed.

Relevant issue: https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15767
Fixed upstream on master (will not be released [until February 5th](https://github.com/curl/curl/discussions/15977)): https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/9fce2c55d4b0273ac99b59bd8cb982a6d96b88cf

#### Impact

Impacts all packages built against curl 8.11.1, including Nix, since:
  - nixos-unstable: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/364160
  - nixos-24.11: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/364355

Impacts users using multiple private caches, particularly if set up using the cachix CLI.

### Steps to reproduce

Add a password-only entry to `.netrc`, followed by any other entry. The first entry will not be used by curl.

```
machine <hostname> password <password>
machine <anotherhostname> password <password>
```

A more concrete repro against a live private cache:

netrc:
```
machine nixpkgs-netrc-repro.cachix.org password eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJqdGkiOiI3M2FiMDE1Mi1mNGU0LTQ1MTAtYjM4NC02NGVmNjAyZmNlNWMiLCJzY29wZXMiOiJjYWNoZSJ9.GPuZHYqV5NmSJW24D2F8ZgLEWimONAoVtzi_Xn4CwMQ
machine anythingelse.example.org login hello password world
```

```console
curl -v https://nixpkgs-netrc-repro.cachix.org/nix-cache-info --netrc-file /path/to/netrc
```

On 8.11.1, you'll get a 401 because the token is not used.
On 8.11.0, you'll get a 200.

### Expected behaviour

Password-less netrc entries should be parsed. See repro.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```console

```

### Additional context

_No response_

### System metadata

system: "x86_64-linux", multi-user?: no, version: nix-env (Nix) 2.24.11, nixpkgs: e24b4c09e963677b1beea49d411cd315a024ad3a

### Notify maintainers

cc @domenkozar 
---

**Note for maintainers:** Please tag this issue in your pull request description. (i.e. `Resolves #ISSUE`.)


### I assert that this issue is relevant for Nixpkgs

- [x] I assert that this is a bug and not a support request.
- [x] I assert that this is not a [duplicate of an existing issue](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%220.kind%3A+bug%22+-label%3A%226.topic%3A+darwin%22+-label%3A%226.topic%3A+nixos%22). 
- [x] I assert that I have read the [NixOS Code of Conduct](https://github.com/NixOS/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) and agree to abide by it.

### Is this issue important to you?

Add a :+1: [reaction] to [issues you find important].

[reaction]: https://github.blog/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/
[issues you find important]: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Areactions-%2B1-desc

issue.title: curl: patch netrc parsing bug for password-only entries

labels.name: 10.rebuild-darwin: 5001+
labels.description: This PR causes many rebuilds on Darwin and must target the staging branches.

labels.name: 10.rebuild-linux: 5001+
labels.description: This PR causes many rebuilds on Linux and must target the staging branches.

issue.body:
<!--
^ Please summarise the changes you have done and explain why they are necessary here ^

For package updates please link to a changelog or describe changes, this helps your fellow maintainers discover breaking updates.
For new packages please briefly describe the package or provide a link to its homepage.
-->

Patches curl to fix a netrc parsing bug where password-only entries are silently ignored under certain conditions.

This bug affects all packages using curl 8.11.1, including Nix. curl 8.11.1 is in both stable and unstable.

Resolves #376106.

nixpkgs issue: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/376106
curl issue: https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15767
patch source: https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/9fce2c55d4b0273ac99b59bd8cb982a6d96b88cf

#### Alternatives

1. Upstream plans to release curl 8.12 on February 5th, so the alternative is to wait until then, given the scale of the rebuild.

2. We could add a feature flag and just patch Nix, like we did a few years ago: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/176974/files

cc @domenkozar 

## Things done

<!-- Please check what applies. Note that these are not hard requirements but merely serve as information for reviewers. -->

- Built on platform(s)
  - [x] x86_64-linux
  - [x] aarch64-linux
  - [ ] x86_64-darwin
  - [x] aarch64-darwin (broken, unrelated to PR. See https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/376043)
- For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in `nix.conf`? (See [Nix manual](https://nixos.org/manual/nix/stable/command-ref/conf-file.html))
  - [ ] `sandbox = relaxed`
  - [ ] `sandbox = true`
- [x] Tested, as applicable:
  - [NixOS test(s)](https://nixos.org/manual/nixos/unstable/index.html#sec-nixos-tests) (look inside [nixos/tests](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/nixos/tests))
  - and/or [package tests](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/pkgs/README.md#package-tests)
  - or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in [lib/tests](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/lib/tests) or [pkgs/test](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/pkgs/test)
  - made sure NixOS tests are [linked](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/pkgs/README.md#linking-nixos-module-tests-to-a-package) to the relevant packages
- [ ] Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using `nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD"`. Note: all changes have to be committed, also see [nixpkgs-review usage](https://github.com/Mic92/nixpkgs-review#usage)
- [x] Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in `./result/bin/`)
- [25.05 Release Notes](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/nixos/doc/manual/release-notes/rl-2505.section.md) (or backporting [24.11](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/nixos/doc/manual/release-notes/rl-2411.section.md) and [25.05](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/nixos/doc/manual/release-notes/rl-2505.section.md) Release notes)
  - [ ] (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
  - [ ] (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
  - [ ] (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
- [x] Fits [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

body: Given that https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-11053.html recommends applying e9b9bba to fix a vulnerability, that advisory should probably be updated to recommend applying 9fce2c5 as well to avoid introducing a new regression.

issue.title: CVE-2024-11053.md: update fixes
issue.body:
- Mention that the fix for this CVE, curl/curl@e9b9bba, caused a regression that was fixed by curl/curl@9fce2c5.

Bug: https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15767#issuecomment-2638547551
Reported-by: Dan Fandrich

Closes #xxxxx
